a1: CIDR (Classless Inter-Domain Routing) notation uses a slash followed by a number (e.g., /24) to indicate the number of bits in the network mask.
q2: What is the difference between network and broadcast address?
a2: The network address is the first IP in a subnet (all host bits 0), while the broadcast address is the last IP (all host bits 1).
q3: How many usable hosts does a /24 subnet have?
a3: A /24 subnet has 254 usable host addresses (256 total minus network and broadcast addresses).
a4: A wildcard mask is the inverse of the subnet mask. It is used in access control lists (ACLs) and routing protocols.
